title: If one third is subtracted from twice the number the result is 55 what is the number? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let the number be represented by (X) Let us represent one third of the number by X/3 (X*1/3) The equation goes thus: 2X - X/3 = 55 Let us multiply each side by 3, we have: 3*(2X - X/3) = 55*3 6X - X = 165 5X = 165 X = 165/5 X = 33. The number is 33
If one third is subtracted from twice the number the result is 55 what is the number? Solution: Let the number = N. 2N - (N/3) = 55 6N-N = 3*55 = 165 5N = 165, or N, the number is 33. Answer.
2x-x/3=55 6x-x=55*3 =165 5x=165 x=33 Twice the number =66 One third of the number =11 66–11=55
